intro: Lerchenfeldia flexuosa var. straminea, commonly known as the yellow-leaved spurge, is a perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value lies in its vibrant leaf color and ability to add visual interest to garden landscapes.
